edu.brown.cs.gk16.autocorrect

Class AcObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.brown.cs.gk16.autocorrect.AcObject

  • public class AcObject
extends Object
    This class is the representation of the autocorrect object. That means it stores all the corpus information in a trie and all the autocorrect settings and handles the autocorrect algorithms with the trie.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AcObject()
      Takes in no parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AcObject

        public AcObject()
        Takes in no parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • addCorpus

        public int addCorpus(String file)
        Opens and reads a txt file containing words that form the data upon which the autocorrect object makes and ranks suggestions. Stores the words in the trie and the frequencies of unigrams/bigrams/ngrams in hashmaps.
        Parameters:
        file - the file containing text
        Returns:
        0 if no error occurs, -1 if an error occurs

      • addWords

        public void addWords(List<String> input,
                     String file,
                     boolean lower)
        Adds words from a corpus to the autocorrect object.
        Parameters:
        input - list of strings comprising the input
        file - the file from which the words were taken
        lower - details whether the input should be lowercase

      • autocorrect

        public List<String> autocorrect(String words,
                                boolean lower)
        Handles the autocorrect command- given the user input, finds and ranks all the suggestions depending on whether prefix, whitespace, led, and smart are on. Returns the suggestions as a list of strings with the first being the best suggestion.
        Parameters:
        words - a string containing the user's input
        lower - details if input should be lower case
        Returns:
        a list of strings containing the top five ranked suggestions, the first one being the best and the last being the worst

      • getSuggestions

        public List<String> getSuggestions(String word)
        Given a word, returns a list of the possible autocorrect suggestions. The suggestions depend on whether the user has turned on the prefix setting, has turned on the whitespace setting, and has increased the led setting to greater than 0.
        Parameters:
        word - the word inputted to get the autocorrect suggestions for
        Returns:
        the list of suggestions

      • sortByNGramFreq

        public List<String> sortByNGramFreq(List<String> suggestions,
                                    List<String> prevWords,
                                    int nsize)
        Given a list of autocorrect suggestions, ranks and sorts the list based on the ngram probability. The integer n denotes the size of the gram (i.e. if n = 2, sorts based on bigram probability). Recursively, then sorts on n -1 gram probability for suggestions with equal n probability.
        Parameters:
        suggestions - a list of strings representing the autocorrect suggestions
        prevWords - the previous words in the form of a list of strings - NOTE: the size of the list must be at least size n
        nsize - the size of the ngrams to sort by
        Returns:
        the ranked list of suggestions (the first having the highest ngram probability)

      • sortByBigramAndUnigramFreq

        public List<String> sortByBigramAndUnigramFreq(List<String> suggestions,
                                               String prevWord)
        Given a list of autocorrect suggestions, ranks and sorts the list based on the bigram probability. In other words, if prevWord is not null (i.e. the user inputted more than one word) then the words are first ranked by bigram probability, how frequently they appear after the prevWord, and then unigram probability and then alphabetically.
        Parameters:
        suggestions - a list of strings representing the autocorrect suggestions (bigram suggestions must be already loaded from a corpus and thus in the bigramFreq hashmap)
        prevWord - a word representing the second to last inputted word, cannot be null
        Returns:
        the ranked list of suggestions (the first having the highest bigram probability)

      • sortByUnigramFreq

        public List<String> sortByUnigramFreq(List<String> suggestions)
        Given a list of suggestions, ranks and sorts the list based on the frequency of the unigrams (the first token of each element in the list to account for white space suggestions) in order of most common to least common. If any suggestions have the same unigram frequency, they're ranked and sorted alphabetically.
        Parameters:
        suggestions - list of suggestions to be sorted (suggestions must be already loaded from a corpus and thus in the frequencies hashmap)
        Returns:
        the sorted list of suggestions

      • getLedSuggestions

        public List<String> getLedSuggestions(String word)
        Finds all the word suggestions in the given trie whose levenshtein edit distance from the given word is less than or equal to the given distance criteria.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to calculate the led from
        Returns:
        a list of strings containing all the led suggestions

      • getLedWords

        public HashMap<Integer,List<String>> getLedWords(String word)
        Finds and returns all the words contained in the trie whose levenshtein edit distance from the given word is less than or equal to the current led value. Returns words in a hashmap where the keys are led distances.
        Parameters:
        word - the word from which to calculate the levenshtein edit distance
        Returns:
        a hashmap containing all the words in the trie with the correct led distances

      • splitWord

        public List<String> splitWord(String word)
        Takes in a string and determines if the string can be split into two different valid words (check if the words are contained in the tree). Represents any possible split as a string with a space in between the complete words (will only have two words) and then returns all possible splits as a list of strings.
        Parameters:
        word - word to be determined if splittable
        Returns:
        list of strings representing any possible splits

        public void setPrefix(boolean setting)
        Parameters:
        setting - boolean detailing what to set the prefix setting to

        Returns:
